this_title: Tulia, Texas: Scenes from the Drug War
trans_title: 德克萨斯州图利亚市：毒品战争中的景象
introduction: Tulia, Texas is the site of what's been called one of the worst miscarriages of justice in recent memory. It's where an undercover narcotics officer named Tom Coleman arrested 46 people - nearly all of them black - on charges of being cocaine dealers, sending many of them to prison for a total of 750 years. See the documentary that brought national media attention to the story and led to the exoneration of these wrongfully convicted men and women.
chinese_title: 德克萨斯州图利亚市：毒品战争中的景象
foreign_title: Tulia, Texas: Scenes from the Drug War
